pronunciation: WALLOW, [Latin , G. This verb seems to be connected with well, walk, etc.]

definitions.text:
1. To roll ones body the earth, mire, or other substance; tumble and roll water. Swine wallow the mire.
2. To move heavily and clumsily.Part huge of bulk, wallowing unwieldy, enormous their gait, tempest the ocean. [Unusual.]
3. To live filth or gross vice; as man wallowing native impurity.WALLOW,
To roll ones body.WALLOW thyself ashes. Jeremiah 6:26.WALLOW,
